actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-250, by Mr. Gordon.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3371 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The Rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill and makes in order consideration of the amendment recommended by the Committee on Judiciary, as modified by amendments printed in part 1 of the report accompanying the resolution, as an original bill for the purpose of amendment. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment to the Judiciary substitute, as modified by the amendments printed in part 1 of the report shall be in order, except those printed in part 2 of the report accompanying this resolution. Said amendments to be considered and in the order, manner, for a time specified and considered read. Amendments en bloc specified in the report shall not ...
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 62.
LAID ON TABLE - H. Res. 246 was laid on the table pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 247.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 247, H. Res. 246 is laid on the table.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3371) to control and prevent crime.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 3371 (crime control).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3371) to control and prevent crime.
